comments:
Buildfile: /tmp/buildUpdate.sh-nickb/1/org.eclipse.releng.generators/buildProductUpdateJars.xml

run:
     [echo] Running ProductUpdateBuilder for 3 or 4-part jars (eg., 2.2.0 or 2.2.0.I200509221234) ...
     [echo] org.eclipse.releng.generators.ProductUpdateBuilder
     [echo]   -add4thPart -root /tmp/buildUpdate.sh-nickb/1/org.eclipse.releng.generators/updateJars/ecli
pse -build S200511100200 -buildDesc 2.2.0M3 -site /tmp/buildUpdate.sh-nickb/1/org.eclipse.releng.generato
rs/updateJars/site -sitexml site-interim.xml -propertiesFile /tmp/buildUpdate.sh-nickb/1/org.eclipse.rele
ng.generators/emf.properties -debug 0
     [echo] Requires: /tmp/buildUpdate.sh-nickb/1/org.eclipse.releng.generators/../org.eclipse.releng.bas
ebuilder/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi.jar (renamed from *_x.y.z.jar)
     [java] java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/osgi/framework/BundleException
     [java]     at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.ExecuteJava.execute(ExecuteJava.java:180)

In M3, org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.0.jar was renamed to
org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.0.v20051030.jar, so I had to make the plugin renamer/mapper
(buildProductUpdateJars.xml:43) more generic:

OLD:
       <move todir="${base.builder}/plugins">
        <fileset dir="${base.builder}/plugins"><include
name="**/org.eclipse.osgi*.jar"/></fileset>
        <mapper type="regexp" from="org.eclipse.osgi_([\d\.])+\.jar"
to="org.eclipse.osgi.jar"/>
      </move>

NEW:
       <move todir="${base.builder}/plugins">
        <fileset dir="${base.builder}/plugins"><include
name="**/org.eclipse.osgi*.jar"/></fileset>
        <mapper type="regexp" from="org.eclipse.osgi_.*\.jar"
to="org.eclipse.osgi.jar"/>
       </move>
